name: Maximum number of intercalates in an extended self-orthogonal diagonal Latin square of order n.
comment: A self-orthogonal diagonal Latin square (SODLS) is a diagonal Latin square orthogonal to its transpose. An extended self-orthogonal diagonal Latin square (ESODLS) is a diagonal Latin square that has an orthogonal diagonal Latin square from the same main class. SODLS is a special case of ESODLS.
link: Eduard I. Vatutin, About the properties of ESODLS of orders 1-10 (in Russian).
Eduard I. Vatutin, Proving list, minimum number of intercalates (best known examples).
Eduard I. Vatutin, Proving list, maximum number of intercalates (best known examples).
Index entries for sequences related to Latin squares and rectangles.
author: _Eduard I. Vatutin_, Apr 09 2025

name: a(n) is the number of distinct numbers of intercalates extended self-orthogonal diagonal Latin squares of order n.
comment: A self-orthogonal diagonal Latin square (SODLS, see A329685) is a diagonal Latin square orthogonal to its transpose. An extended self-orthogonal diagonal Latin square (ESODLS, see A309210) is a diagonal Latin square that has an orthogonal diagonal Latin square from the same main class. SODLS is a special case of ESODLS.
link: Eduard I. Vatutin, About the properties of ESODLS of orders 1-10 (in Russian).
Index entries for sequences related to Latin squares and rectangles.
example: For n=7 the number of intercalates that a diagonal Latin square of order 7 may have is 0, 10, or 18. Since there are 3 distinct values, a(7)=3.
author: _Eduard I. Vatutin_, Apr 10 2025
